Have the wedding ceremony in a natural setting such as a park or beach, and use eco-friendly decorations made from recycled materials or biodegradable materials.
Choose a catering company that uses locally sourced and organic ingredients, and provide guests with reusable water bottles or pitchers instead of disposable plastic cups.
Use LED or solar-powered lighting for the reception, and have guests use electronic invitations instead of paper ones to reduce paper waste.
Have a "green" transportation option for guests, such as a shuttle service that uses electric or hybrid vehicles, or have guests carpool or use public transportation to get to the wedding.
Instead of traditional favors, have guests take home small potted plants or seeds to plant in their own gardens, or have a donation made to an environmental organization in their name.
